explanation: The report is correct. The call (void *)name discards the const qualifier of the string when passing it to OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch whose parameter is void *arg. The match function OS_FileSys_FindVirtMountPoint treats the argument as const (it immediately casts to const char *), which indicates the argument should be const-qualified. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types whenever possible, so the API and the caller are not const-correct. The proper fix is to propagate const: change OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch (and the OS_ObjectMatchFunc_t prototype/os_ObjectIdFindNextMatch etc.) to take a const void *arg (and change the match-function parameter to const void *ref), and remove the cast at the call site. Alternatively avoid removing the const qualifier.
